newsitem.title: USA: Wyo. Laramie River 550 MW unit seen shutting Fri.
newsitem.headline: Wyo. Laramie River 550 MW unit seen shutting Fri.

text.p: The 550 megawatt (MW) unit 3 at the Laramie River Station (LRS) in Wheatland, Wyoming, will be taken off-line Friday for about six weeks of planned maintenance, according to sources familiar with the plant's operations.
Meanwhile, the plant's 550 MW unit 2 continues to operate near 60 percent capacity, but was expected to resume full operations around midnight Thursday, the sources said.
The third 550 MW unit at LRS was said to be operating normally.
Basin Electric Cooperative, headquartered in Bismark, North Dakota, operates and has a 42 percent interest in the plant, with five other Midwest utilities co-owning the remaining interest.
